title: (7570) Grândola - 45 Rua Maria Espada Feio Beatriz
title_short: (7570) Grândola - 45 Rua Maria Espada Feio Beatriz
description:
Picnic tables and barbecue available, next to a tiny stream.
Workout equipment present. Fig tree.
The municipality is working on installing toilets to turn the area into an eco spot. It is legal to park here overnight.
Good for a snack stop but close to the road, noisy to spend the night.

title: (7570-239) Grândola - 12 Avenida António Inácio da Cruz
title_short: (7570-239) Grândola - 12 Avenida António Inácio da Cruz
description: Parking on the streets next to the park. Public toilets open from 08:00-20:00 in the park close to the fountain. Slept one night felt safe. Police passed several times without saying anything. But we kept our door shut to not disturb anyone.

title: (7570-177) Grândola - 18 Rua Doutor Jacinto Nunes
description: Self-service laundromat with three washing and drying machines each, change machine, television, seating, WiFi and sockets. Open 2a a domingo 07:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. Parking is possible at the park around the corner. Another salon one street further.

title: (7570) Grândola - 12A Rua Dr.José Pereira Barradas
description: Small square clay near quiet subdivision 3 places about no service but quiet for one night

title: (7570) Grândola - Parque de Grândola
description: Free Parking, Facilities in Sport complex.

title: (7570-175) Grândola - 2 Rua 1 de Maio
description: Located on the country road and a little louder. Motorhomes are not prohibited. Trash can tables and benches permanently installed. Lidl next door.

title: (7570) Grândola - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place  near a small chapel in the middle of Kirkeichen. Gorgeous view, absolutely quiet

title: (7570-125) Grândola -
description: No estacionamento do hipermercado modelo continente tem 4 lugares reservados a autocaravanas

title: (7570-128) Grândola - 33 N120
description: It is a BP gas station Free water supply Rest area with tables and shade Very clean gas station toilets, water and bidet. Do not plug in the toilets.

title: (7570) Grândola - A. do Sul
description: Rest area on A2 motorway. Standard parking, gas station and restaurant. Good to have a rest during the trip.

title: (7570) Santa Margarida da Serra - Unnamed Road
title_short: (7570) Santa Margarida da Serra - Unnamed Road
description:
This idyllic and quiet place is surrounded by nature. Sheep, chickens, vegetable garden and a breathtaking view of the clear starry sky.

Access is via gravel roads.

One night against donation. Longer stays with the opportunity to help out in the vegetable garden, with the animals, with construction, etc. are possible by arrangement.

Love Alex

PS: Garden with fresh vegetables is available.

title: (7570) Grândola - Unnamed Road
description: Nice square with several tables and benches in picturesque Alentejo village.

title: (7570) Grândola -
description: Water source

title: (7540-551) - 30 Rua Da Eira
description: Small space without service for a break or a night on the road from Lisbon to Faro

title: (7540) Cruz João Mendes - 38 N120
description: Public toilets with WC and drinking water.

title: () - IC33
description: Small space without service for a break or a night on the road from Lisbon to Faro

title: (7570) Grândola -
description: Simple stopping point on the old disused national road. Almost no noise, except those of the few trains passing from time to time in the distance.

title: (7580) - Unnamed Road
description: I stood here for a couple of hours. But it shouldn't be a problem even at night. Off-road. Well suited for transit. You can stand there pretty well anywhere. Just drive around a bit.

title: (7570-633) Melides - 16 EN261-2
description: Water tap to the left of the shed with laundry

title: (7570) Melides - Rua 5 de Outubro
description: Quiet, paved, isolated and clean. Parking spots in a "under development" construction area.

title: (7570) Melides - 1A Travessa do Futuro
description: Public bathrooms with individual showers. Option to use soap.

title: (7570) Melides - N261
description: Ample parking of the school and sports field.

title: (7570) Melides - 7A EN261-2
description: Nice parking spot, cool to stay the night and close (3min) to a public toilets and showers (next to the local market)

title: (7570) Melides - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet and beautiful place

title: (7570) Melides - Vale Figueira
description: Water public

title: (7570) Melides - 3 Rua Comandante Ramiro Correia
description: Local people get drinking water here. No tap but filling bottles is fine. Two large parking places.

title: (7580) - IC1
description: Faucet on a gas station. He is usable. The costs are unknown to me. We did not need water. You could ask at the gas station.

title: (7570) Melides - N261
description: Water point with threaded tap (good pressure)

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - Estr. Nacional 262
description: Small parking lot at the cemetery. perfect for spending the day on the way between the Algarve and Lisbon without detour.

title: (7540) - N121
description:
Motorhome/caravan overnight parking, private, fenced with controlled access (entry and exit) by video images for user safety. Provides non-drinking water. Price to be charged per vehicle only regardless of the number of occupants or pets. Time limit for entry to the park 11pm for total rest for those who are there.
Park in a natural environment where all the electrical energy used is of solar origin limiting its use. we have only one SOS point made available for life support purposes

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado -
description: Alternative to the motorhome area if nature is needed. quiet corner next to a wood. lake 5 min walk. we stayed 2 nights with no problem.

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado -
description: Directly at the reservoir only for vans. With larger motorhomes it is possible but difficult. The road is very washed out with lots of potholes. There is only a turning point at the end of the path. If in doubt, walk down the path to see if you can get through.

title: (7570) Setúbal - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place near the lake, not crowded at all. The abandoned water pumping station to protect from the rain is near. Very tasty toast and grapes in the cafe near the old steam locomotive produced in Paris in 1891 :) new motorhome parking.

name: Monte Zen Melides
title: (7570) Monte Zen Melides
description:
We value serenity and privacy, which is why we ask you to make pre-reservations before your arrival. Thus, we ensure that each one has a space reserved especially for him, allowing him to enjoy nature and his environment in peace.

Welcome to Monte Zen Melides - the perfect retreat for motorhomes seeking tranquility and connection with nature. Located just 2.5 km from the beautiful beach and lagoon of Melides, our space offers a relaxing and secure stay amid stunning natural scenery.

Imagine waking up to the sound of birdsong, surrounded by the pristine beauty of the natural landscape. Monte Zen Melides is a real sanctuary for nature lovers, where they can explore peaceful paths, admire the local fauna and flora, and relax under a starry sky.

In addition, the proximity to the beach and the lagoon of Melides offers a unique opportunity to indulge in the sea and the sun. Take a walk on the golden sands, take a dip in the crystal clear waters or just lay back and enjoy the warmth of the sun while listening to the gentle sound of the waves.

During your stay here, enjoy the exclusivity of our private space, designed to provide you with a unique and peaceful experience. We will always be ready to ensure that your stay is memorable and carefree.

At Monte Zen Melides, nature and the beach come together to provide unforgettable moments. Pre-book now and prepare for an invigorating experience immersed in the peace and harmony of this lush setting. We look forward to welcoming you soon! We do not have electricity service.

title: (7540) Santa Cruz - 121 R. Menino do Freixo
title_short: (7540) Santa Cruz - 121 R. Menino do Freixo
description: Nice spot for backpacker, earth and gravel on the ground, not flat but satellite and 4g works. No service only 1 trash can and water from the washer basins for washing clothes.

title: (7570) Minas do Lousal -
description: Big flat Parking unused. Seems to be for visitors of the museum or for train station. 100 meter bumpy road shortly before.

title: (7570) Minas do Lousal - 210 Rua 25 Abril
description:
The gate is open. A quiet, safe place in a small village. Choice of sun & shade spots. The facilities are in good order and clean. Every pitch has electricity. The drinking water does not have a connection for a garden hose. Behind the building is another water point, it might be easier there if you want to fill large amounts of water.

If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs against the barking of the (stray) dogs. Occasionally they make a lot of noise, but not continuously.

The mining museum is nice to visit, even when it is closed you can walk through it and read the information boards.

You can also walk to the river. I saw a camper here, but I don't know if spending the night there is allowed.

I have not seen any police, GNR or any form of control in 3 days. But the village is so small that the locals keep an eye on it themselves, I think.

title: (7570) Melides - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking to see the famous cliffs of Galé beach.
About ten spaces in 2 car parks.

title: (7570) Melides - Unnamed Road
description: Muito tranquilo e a 10 min da praia. Espaço limitado a poucas autocaravanas. A segurança passa regularmente sem qualquer interferência. Bom local para uma noite ou duas ?

name: Alentejo Litoral Caravan Park
title: (7500) Alentejo Litoral Caravan Park
description:
Private Pedro's nature service area
For motorhomes and similar vehicles.

we open at 10:00 am and close at 22 pm

Please note;
that at the entrance of the park, there's the rules on the wall, and you should call before getting in!!!

Our services;
1-Staying overnight from 19h until 11h.

2-Staying the 24h period.

3- Quad 4x4 renting, 

4- Bungalows to rent
(information on the spot)

Except from electricity,
all other services are free
(hot showers, barbecue, service area, natural Shadows) etc 

Note:

We do not have toilets (yet) you should have your own!!
otherwise you will not get in!
the space is a service area not a camping park!!

We have an area with farm animals which is good for our children.
and every morning the animals come outside and meet everybody.

come and visit us welcome

title: (7570) Melides - Unnamed Road
description: At the end of a paved path, for a perfect night in the company of mosquitoes! Van or van ok. Access to the beach on foot or by 4x4

title: (7570) Melides -
description: Go to the end of the small sandy path you will have a view of the sea with very few passers-by and a very pretty, uncrowded beach. Good camp

title: (7500-016) Paio - 124 Rua da Nortada
description: A small tap with drinking water, right beside the road.

title: (7540-205) Santiago do Cacém - 3 Rua Ramos da Costa
title_short: (7540-205) Santiago do Cacém - 3 Rua Ramos da Costa
description: Laundromat, 200 m walk from the motorhome area, closer than that of Intermarche. Possibility to take a customer card giving the right to reductions. Prices for washing: 10 kg 4 euros - 20 kg 8 euros and for drying: 20 kg 2 euros. Clean, television, armchairs and tables, trash can, drink dispenser and wifi.

title: (7500-016) Paio - 23 Rua da Medronheirinha
description: Area with wooden tables and chairs to stop to eat. There is shade under the pines and a tap to catch water. It is right next to the Camping. There is also a trash bin.

title: (7500) Paio - 4 Rua do Ti Caniço
description: Regular parking but ever quite big car can fit there. At building below small grocery store. It possible to buy here gas bottles as well. When parking next to beach is closed for motorhomes, I've put my car here for couple of hours.

title: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 14 Rua Vasco da Gama
title_short: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 14 Rua Vasco da Gama
description: Quiet place to park very close to the historic center and the castle

name: Santo André Lagoon
title: () Santo André Lagoon
description: Park of Campismo da Lagoa de Santo André. The nearest campsite to enjoy the lagoon and the sea... Good welcome, accessible and clean sanitary facilities, delimited and wide motorhome pitches, electricity included. A good technical stopover to get everything up to speed

title: () Santiago do Cacém - 18 Estrada do Fidalgo
title_short: () Santiago do Cacém - 18 Estrada do Fidalgo
description: Parking with free service of clean and dirty water. Not accessible to heavyweight '.

title: (7570) Melides - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful sand track, well deflated tires at 1kg only in 4x4, magnificent spot to spend the night

title: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 7 N261-3
description: Source on the same road and very easy to stop to load.

title: (7500) Santiago do Cacém -
description: A nice place for one night. We then visited the Safari Park Badoca, which is located directly opposite. At night you can hear the animals from the park.

title: (7540-195) Santiago do Cacém - 11 R. das Nogueiras
title_short: (7540-195) Santiago do Cacém - 11 R. das Nogueiras
description:
Public toilets by outdoor swimming pool. Bins around the park, couple of drinking water points.
Picnic área 
hot showers

title: (7570) Melides -
description: Pass a small sandy path at the level of the car park (quite passable by car/van…) to reach flat land surrounded by pine trees just behind the beach. The land is very calm with the sound of the waves when you wake up. Fairly clean, keep as is.

title: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 5 Estrada do Fidalgo
title_short: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 5 Estrada do Fidalgo
description: Washing machine and dryer at Intermarche. You can use the time for shopping (Aldi or Intermarche)

title: (7500) Santiago do Cacém - 13 A26-1
description: Small car park at the start of the walk to visit the nature reserve das lagoas de santo andre e da sancha. Lots of explanatory panels along the walk it's very nice to do and very pleasant to walk in peace (even the children are silent to see the animals)

title: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 96 N120
description: A care place behind the Intermarché. The tap for drinking water in the middle is not always there, but the girl from the gas pump can turn it on or you can use pliers.

title: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 14 Estrada do Fidalgo
title_short: (7540) Santiago do Cacém - 14 Estrada do Fidalgo
description: On 06/28/2022 we saw that in the ALDI supermarket they were enabling three overnight places for motorhomes. Thank you very much Aldi for this initiative. The place is flat and set back from the road, possibly some noise in the morning from the chain's delivery trucks. A few meters away is the Intermarché supermarket, with black and gray emptying and water intake; and possibility of refueling.

name: Pacha Mama Community
title: (7580-305) Pacha Mama Community
description:
We are the PachaMama community and we would love to welcome you to our cozy little farm. 
We have everything you need including toilets, hot showers, wifi, chill-out zone with games, and a fully equipped kitchen. 

On Saturdays, we host an all-you-can-eat Pizza Party and you are very welcome to join!


There are a lot of animals and dogs on the farm and you are welcome to bring your own pet. 
We have a canal that runs through our 
property where you can cool off in the fresh water in the summer time. We also have a yoga dome with daily yoga classes.

There are two ways to reach us; either from the main road, or the other road crossing the small village of Bairro da 
Quintinha. NEVER take the road that crosses the village, it is very sandy and there is a great risk of getting stuck! Instead, turn right off the main road just before IC1. 

We look forward to welcoming you! :))

title: (7570) - BP N261
description: Grill, some benches and tables. Also water.

title: (7570-779) - 13A Avenida 18 de Dezembro
description: Self-service laundry

title: () Santiago do Cacém - Avenida de Sines
title_short: () Santiago do Cacém - Avenida de Sines
description:
Intermarché Santo André

Good place to stay. Very quiet. Everything is free (WasteWater,Black Water, Waste Container, Fresh Water, WC (no Showers)).
Also have the Supermarket and the night guard !!!
You can also wash and dry your clothes (need to pay for that).

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - 7565 N121
description:
Self-service laundry.
Parking in front of the vending machines.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 1296 N120
description: Free parking! Great location. You are right on the river (not for swimming). Clean restroom on site. Large playground right next door. You can walk to a castle (uphill). There are restaurants, pharmacies, shops etc. nearby. The city is nicely lit up in the evenings.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 1296 N120
description: Parking on concrete floor, level, next to the restaurant and parking in which they have forbidden to park the campers. Same as next to the information desk, public toilets and access to the village, which is really nice and original and well worth a visit. Stuck on the road and so noisy, and surrounded by thousands of mosquitoes. ID provided with repellent!

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 81 Avenida João Soares Branco
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 81 Avenida João Soares Branco
description: public parking directly at many restaurants.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 80 Avenida João Soares Branco
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 80 Avenida João Soares Branco
description: Public tap I don't know if it's drinkable.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua do Cabo da Vila
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua do Cabo da Vila
description: Free park.

title: (7580-520) Alcácer do Sal - N120
description: Romantic place near the restaurant on the shore, great in the evening for sunset and when the city starts to light up! Great sound ambience and very quiet :)

title: (7580-231) Alcácer do Sal - Av. dos Aviadores
title_short: (7580-231) Alcácer do Sal - Av. dos Aviadores

title_short: (7580-158) Alcácer do Sal - 23 Rua Engenheiro António Gentil Soares Branco
description: Drinking water fountain with parking space

address.street: 23 Rua Engenheiro António Gentil Soares Branco

title: (7580-509) Alcácer do Sal - 2 Rua do Cabo da Vila
title_short: (7580-509) Alcácer do Sal - 2 Rua do Cabo da Vila
description: Large free parking at the entrance of the Alcacer do Sol. Used mainly for the Bull-shows in the Praca de Toiros, but almost empty the other days.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 6 Rua do Hospital Velho
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 6 Rua do Hospital Velho
description: Large parking space Parking on land next to a bell tower with superb views of the surroundings. Very quiet we spent the night

title: (7580-151) Alcácer do Sal - 16 Calçada da Fonte Nova
title_short: (7580-151) Alcácer do Sal - 16 Calçada da Fonte Nova
description: Public tap. Not directly accessible by vehicle.

title: (7580-211) Alcácer do Sal - 10 Rua Comandante João Bico
title_short: (7580-211) Alcácer do Sal - 10 Rua Comandante João Bico
description: Public tap with the possibility to park the vehicle in front of it

title: (7565) Ermidas do Sado - IC1
description: Drinking water from two wells, picnic area available, approx. 10 parking spaces.

title: (7500-170) Santiago do Cacém - 17 Rua do Mercado
title_short: (7500-170) Santiago do Cacém - 17 Rua do Mercado
description: Quiet parking to spend the day, away from noise and the city. Surrounded by several supermarkets. We spent the day and very well, we moved away from the beach area due to excessive humidity.

name: Camping of Alcacer do Sal
title: (7580) Camping of Alcacer do Sal
description: Small municipal campsite, very nice, inexpensive, the campsite is quiet, intermarché 50m away with CC station, lidl nearby, restaurant close to the campsite, swimming pool close to the campsite for 2nd and free for children. small downside: mosquitoes, and flies in the evening it is almost impossible to eat outside.

address.street: 4 Rua do Independente Futebol Clube Alcacerense

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua do Independente Futebol Clube Alcacerense
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua do Independente Futebol Clube Alcacerense
description: Parking authorized 24h. Very, very quiet, no wild animals, no dogs, no traffic, no young people talking ... Absolute calm. If the laundry ends late Intermarché, just make 70 m to spend a dream night. Even without laundry, it works too.

address.street: Rua do Independente Futebol Clube Alcacerense

title: (7570) - Alameda da Praia do Pego
description: Camper place with V/disposal. You can spend the night. 5 large RV sites

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 3 Avenida José Saramago
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - 3 Avenida José Saramago
description: Service area at Intermarché

title: (7500) Santiago do Cacém - Unnamed Road
description: Parking on the beach Without services. Beginning of Poço da Barbarroxa trail, through the forest, the dune and the beach. For the day only

title: (7570) Carvalhal - Rua Da Faina
description: Free parking for an estimated 6 campers. We stood there for two nights with no problems. 5 minutes walk to Praia do Carvalhal (no mobile homes are allowed in the beach car park, not even during the day). There is a small restaurant opposite. We didn't eat there, but were allowed to use the toilet. There is also a small surf shop. A very nice place with lots of stork nests and a beautiful sunset :)

title: (7500-220) Santiago do Cacém - 37 Avenida de Sines
title_short: (7500-220) Santiago do Cacém - 37 Avenida de Sines
description:
Self service car wash, we fitted with 7m long and 3.1m high motorhome.

Right at the entrance on the left there is a water tap that can fill your dreshwater tank.  3/4” tread.

title: (7595) Torrão - N5
description: Very quiet, panoramic view of the dam. Version 1 right before the bridge, 2 to 3 camping car with air. Before the bridge to the left 1, and after the bridge to doubt 2 see 3. Be careful left after the bridge c forbidden. Property of the state. Narrow road for the PL

title: (4970-500) Torrão -
description: Nice and quiet place right behind the damm. No services at all but flat and with shade. Way to the water is steep but possible. You can walk with your dog for hours without meeting anyone.

name: Fonte do Cortiço
title: (7500) Fonte do Cortiço
description: Parking overlooking the sea, beautiful beach, pine forest. Picnic tables with barbecue, wc and water during the day. Closed at 18h. Take a very walkable dirt road for 2 km.

title: (7500) Santiago do Cacém -
description: Great spot for the day, plenty of off road parking in the woods or on the road as it's wide enough. But to reach this spot a 4x4 is a must and maybe decent tires (I managed without those fancy BF Goodrich AllTerain ;) ) Also super quiet and about 5 minutes from the beach ?

title: (7540) - 4 Largo 25 de Abril
description: Stopped here for a night in a parking place. Luckily we found here a water fountain and very clean free public toilets. The toilets are near the atm.

title: (7565) Mimosa - 2 Rua Liberdade do Povo
description: Water and empty place

title: (7580) Comporta -
description: Place at an abandoned farm. Bridge over. No facilities.

title: (7580) Monte Novo - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in the center of a small village in the middle of a nature reserve. The few locals welcomed us warmly, no water available and playground for children. Change of scenery guaranteed! Surprising location, we recommend this little detour in the middle of cork farms.

title: (7565) Alvalade - 15 Rua de São Pedro
description: Ground parking opposite the stadium and gardens. No service. Had a night in November (so no need for shade!). Calm.

title: (7580) Comporta - N253
description: Sand track, only accessible for 4x4.

title: (7565) Alvalade - 109 Avenida Cinco Outubro
description: Quiet street next to the college which also serves as a parking lot for buses. At the end of the path there is also a large vacant lot. Ok for overnight stay (tested in November). No service. Some shops, post office and gas station in the village. Washing machine in Mimosa the village following north section (Lisbon).

title: (7580) Comporta - 49 Rua das Oliveiras
description: Large parking spaces suitable for motorhomes, at the bottom of a housing estate and close to a natural area. Very quiet and safe. Possibility to spend the night without problem. A few minutes walk from the city center of Comporta.

title: (7580) Comporta - 31 Rua 25 de Abril
description: Ample parking area with shade at the ends. The beautiful beach of Comporta is 10 minutes by bike, 25 minutes on foot. Potable water, sewage, emptying cassette available free of charge. Very quiet day and night, it is close to the GNR.

title: (7580-643) Comporta - 8 Rua do Galeão
description:
Hardware store where you can buy
 gas bottle 907 (the blue one) among many other things. One of the few in the area.
Very good deal.

title: (7580) Comporta - 4 Rua das Salinas
description: Great parking lot in a nice little village. 5 minutes by car to the beach. In the town there are many bars and restaurants which are all great and the prices are completely ok (not overrun with tourists). Parked our van here and had a great evening and slept very well afterwards.

title: (7580-649) Comporta - 6 Rua de São Pedro
description: Ample parking for AC at the back of town next to the sports center. Quiet and shaded in the afternoon.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Unnamed Road
description: 1st Park4night spot armored camping because we crossed the dam and we found this place! Passage 10T ok, quiet.

title: (7595) Torrão - Rua de Santa Maria
description: Beautiful place, close to the water and with a view for the "Montado" (hill with oak trees). Perfect to spend the night and some time.

title: (7580) Comporta - 237 Rua 25 de Abril
description: Drinking water tap in a corner of the roundabout.

title: (7580) Santa Susana - Unnamed Road
description: Public shower with toilet

title: () Albufeira - Barragem Pêgo do Altar
description: Nice place. Very quiet, with a restaurant nearby. There is also a sanitary building with toilet and shower free of charge. Mobile network very limited.

title: (7580) Comporta - 12 Rua do Velho Eucalipto
description:
Quiet, flat place great for shopping and dining at night
==
Lugar calmo e flat bom para pernoitar com comércio e restaurantes

title: () Torrão -
description:
This is a Quinta directly at the lake owned by a family. Warm shower, toilets and a chill area directly at the lake. Enjoy pure nature and observe the wildlife around the lake.
You can come with your caravan or tent. €12.- per van/tent. €3 per extra person/pet.
Contact them before you arrive and make sure they are around.

title: (7580) Santa Susana -
description: A very quiet place surrounded by nature and near the lake. We spent one night there and it was just what we needed. Hope it will be useful for anyone else.

title: (7580) Comporta -
description: Great place!! Beautiful spot to stay at night!! Fisher village nearby! Only 4x4

title: (7580) Albufeira - Unnamed Road
description: You have a parking with several camper when returning to this car park take the small path on your left between the olive trees and continue until the end or you will have a great location for small beach barbecue. Access only by truck or van I think it's complicated camping cam. (restaurant at 500m walk)

title: (7580) Comporta - Unnamed Road
description: Area of interest that is worth seeing

title: (7595) Torrão - N2
description: Pleasant place to spend the night. Near the village, earth access but in good condition, on the edge of an old quarry and near the river.

title: (7595-125) Torrão - 38 Rua João Chagas
description: Convenient to park the time of the rzndo and the visit but not very pretty and dusty

title: (7595) Torrão - N2
description: Small corner for picnic. Does not know if possible to stay the night. But I think so.

title: (7900-252) Figueira dos Cavaleiros - 23 N259
description: A small parking area with a playground for kids. 3G or 4G available ?

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: Just place on the beach. The beach starts after 10 m, then 3 km on the left and 20 km on the right. 1 km restaurant (smoking and non-smoking not separate). No service. Indeed we are just overlooking the beach. The track is a bit scared because of the sand but we do not bog down. Forbidden to spend the night. Camping forbidden

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: Great place next to the water

title: (7580) - Unnamed Road
description: Nice and private area, a bit hidden and away from the other more popular spots at the lake. can be reached via a dirt road through the forest with 2 steep parts. arrival during daylight recommended. 4wd or small campervan (Mercedes Vito/ VW T5 etc) is possible.

title: (7580) Santa Susana - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful, peaceful resovior.
only rubbish facilities

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: Viba Gas Sines GPL (LPG) filling station We filled our Dutch bottle and he has all sorts of converters so he can refill all types of bottles. The owner is super nice, speaks English and even recommended restaurants in town and spots for free-camping nearby.

title: (7520) Sines -
description: Cute little spot by the beach, easily accessible and very quiet. A couple of friendly fisherman park here during daytime.

title: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 1 Travessa Catarina Eufémia
title_short: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 1 Travessa Catarina Eufémia
description: Water with good pressure and screw connection, additional WiFi at the post office.

title: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 1 Rua António Paulino Faria Claro
title_short: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 1 Rua António Paulino Faria Claro
description: Free wifi access, ATM, toilets and showers

title: (7580) Santa Susana - Unnamed Road
description: Very pretty spot, calm and peaceful on the edge of a magnificent pond. You can park anywhere with any type of vehicle. Very easy to access. Trash cans are present at the entrance. Possibility of carrying out several cycling, fishing, swimming and hiking activities as long as you are equipped. Relatively clean, although there is some trash present. Damage. We had a good night there!

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua Primeiro de Maio
title_short: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Rua Primeiro de Maio
description: At the edge of a lake, very large, lots of space. Dirty enough in places do not hesitate to pick up trash!

title: (7580) Herdade da Palma - 35 Rua das Oficinas
title_short: (7580) Herdade da Palma - 35 Rua das Oficinas
description: A series of parking bays in the middle of the village surrounded by fields of chickens, storks and a hysterical little dog in the distance. Funny and relaxing village soundscape.

title: (7520) Sines - 1024 Rua Nº 3
description: Water (non-potable) at the gas station

title: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 26 Rua Primeiro de Maio
title_short: (7580) Santa Susana (Aldeia de Santa Susana) - 26 Rua Primeiro de Maio
description: Village of Santa Susana, access road to the Pego do Altar dam, very quiet area ideal for picnics, with tables, barbecue and water, ideal for having a meal and putting on water. Small parking space.

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: If you like the sound of the waves, this is the place for you. Tipper available. Overnight stay prohibited!

title: (7520-110) Sines -
description: Face à la mer en pleine nature.restaurant bord de plage

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: Perfect for spending the day at the beach. Parking before departure from the nature reserve

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: A place outside the natural park so it is allowed to spend the night. It was full of motorhomes. Quiet place and a road separates it from the beach. Quite close there are several bars or chiringuitos although at night they were closed.

title: () Sines - R261-5
description: Toilet emptying and fresh water (70 liters). There are no official parking spaces for motorhomes. Parking is permitted for the duration of the purchase.

title: (7520) Sines -
description: Laundromat, clean and cheap!

title: (7520) Sines - N120-1
description: We stopped for the night the area is quiet and the view is nice, there are refineries in the distance. No service, access is via a small path without problem with a motorhome of 6.50 m. In the early morning let's say it's a little dirty around.

title: (7520-089) Sines - M1109
description: There are public toilets at the restaurant. Only open in summer!

title: (7580) Largo da Aldeia - 325 Largo da Aldeia
title_short: (7580) Largo da Aldeia - 325 Largo da Aldeia
description: Easy accessible water tap in a small village. Wide roads and plenty of parking space. You can park close. We filled canisters super quickly.

title: (7520-206) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: 3 parking spaces reserved for motorhomes behind mainland, near the laundromat. To get there, do not enter the Continente car park, take the exit just before in the roundabout, which corresponds to the truck entrance. Ideal for shopping and washing clothes

title: (7520) Sines - N120-1
description: If you do not find room in the neighboring area, continue further or better to enter just after the railway bridge on the right coming from Sines. Be careful the weekend there must be people.

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: Parking on the beach

title: (7580) - Rua Primeiro de Maio
description:
Espaço muito tranquilo, pode pernoitar à beira de água, aos fins-de-semana com mais movimento com desportos náuticos, ideal para relax e muito espaço para picnic. Óptimo para as crianças brincarem e andar de bicicleta.
Very quiet space, you can spend the night at the water's edge, on weekends with more movement with water sports, ideal for relaxing and plenty of space for picnics. Great for kids to play and ride a bike.

title: (7580) - 30 Largo da Aldeia
description: Quiet place in pretty little village to spend the night. No service.

title: (7580) Alcácer do Sal - Unnamed Road
description: Great place. Free camping. Views

title: (7500) Sines -
description: Nice place to spend the night. Beautiful sunrise in the morning.

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: A place sheltered from everything and everyone so if you are looking for a place to rest or spend a few days this is ideal, a natural parking in the middle of nature but to get there a 4x4 must be taken, from the provincial a sandy road starts

title: (7555-267) Sines -
description: View to the lake, accessible via dirt road with motorhome. Few other campers on the same road. No services.

title: (N120-1 752) Sines - Unnamed road
description: Sandy path, but we got there without too much difficulty. Absolutely nowhere. Not seen a person. Very friendly like in the jungle.

title: (7520-106) Sines - Av. Gen. Humberto Delgado
description: Free water tap next to the station to inflate the tires

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: Next to the one referenced for the dam and the one under the trees. It is enough that you take the road straight in front of the dam by not turning to the left like the other area and you will see the trees in a path on your left lightly below. Be careful also if it is the rainy season or just after for the lake level.

title: () Sines - N120-1
description: A quiet corner for a fresh water bath, far from the concentration of motorhomes in Porto Covo.

title: (7520) Sines - Unnamed Road
description: Another quiet spot overlooking the lake, nice, flat and covered with gravel.

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: We have stayed one night and there has been no problem to stay overnight. About 100 meters towards Sines there is a very full caravan park so we recommend you stay right in the one in front of the surf booth. There are garbage but there is no for AC. There is a bar 200 meters towards Sines for lunch/dinner, they open at 10am. We loved this parking lot, we were almost alone and the noise from passing cars was not particularly annoying.

title: (7520) Sines - A26-1
description: This is a public parking with great view. Clean surroundings, quiet and very few people.

title: (7520-219) Sines - 127 Rua Júlio Gomes da Silva
title_short: (7520-219) Sines - 127 Rua Júlio Gomes da Silva
description: Insidewash is the name of the laundromat where you can wash clothes

title: (7555) Corgos -
description: On the banks of a dam that dried up at this time. On the edge of a eucalyptus forest. Total calm, only the noise bed insects. Easy access by following the track.

title: (7555) Corgos - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful spot, sheltered from the (s-w) wind. Reachable via gravel road from the dam, around the lake (anti clockwise). Tracks are 4x4 only, since there are some steep muddy climbs to tackle. Surrounded by only nature, didn’t see anyone. No network.

name: Campigir São Torpes
title: () Campigir São Torpes
description: São Torpes campigir. - Cheap camping in nature, with a lot og spots. Friendly staff, close to the beach. All facilities. (The road to the campsite is tottally fine, don't know what the person in the comments mean).

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: 8-10 parking spaces on the beach. the road is not busy at night, only the waves rock a little.Not allowed to stay overnight from midnight to 8am.

title: (7520) Sines - 47 Alameda da Paz
description: Big flat parking. Quiet during the night. Only 5min walk from the castle. 10-15 min walk to the beach

title: (7520) Sines - 15 Rua Paulo da Gama
description: Central parking to visit the village and 2 minutes from the castle.

title: (7520) Sines - 18 Largo Ramos da Costa
description: Very nice place spacious where we could sleep peacefully. There is a staircase where you walk down and you reach the beach. Near the castle wall and eateries / center. No amenities. Slept wonderfully.

title: (7520) Sines - M1109
description: Parking by the sea

title: (7520) Sines - 80 Largo Ramos da Costa
description: Small car park with 6 m long spaces .. ideal for a small motorhome. Have a good trip ✌?

title: (7520-151) Sines -
description: Beautiful place at the foot of the castle of Sines, is usually crowded with cars, I have parked my motorhome of 7,40m. Invading a little the lawn, there are not many parkings for very long vehicles, idyllic space with wonderful views of the castle and the beach of Vasco de gama, recommended to visit the castle, the church, and the museum inside the castle, all free, essential to eat in Adega de Sines, 30 meters away, is a tasca if no luxury, typical of Portugal where you will only find 3 dishes, grilled chicken, grilled fish and stewed beans, all very good and cheap, then there is to taste the typical sweets of the area in the Vela D'ouro bakery, 40 meters from the parking lot, highly recommended as well. There are more parking in the area very close.

title: (7520-242) Sines - 2 Largo do Castelo
description: Drinking water fountain

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo -
description: Magnificent view of the lake. Really quiet in November, some fishermen and hikers. If you enter directly after the dam you can walk along the water (maybe not if the water is higher) but there are some really big puddles on the forest road. We are not trying to enter from the north. enjoy it and keep it clean :)

title: (7520-241) Sines - 40 Rua Serpa Pinto
description:
Here you get a professional cleaning of -I guess- all types of clothing's by friendly staff. I gave one machine with "normal" stuff to wash and also some wool and silk clothes to them, was no problem after a few hours through the beautiful town, I got everything clean, dry and perfect folded in a bag back.
I can really recommend :)

title: (7500) Sines -
description: For the night ..quiet

title: (7520-151) Sines - 5 Rua Sacadura Cabral
description: On the beach road. Public toilets open daytime next to the playground and also on the beach. Slept one night no issues.

title: (7520) Sines - 1 Avenida Vasco da Gama
description: Parking space close to a beautiful beach. Also ideal for visiting this pretty town. The view is very beautiful from the ramparts.

title: (20303) Narva - 5 Tallinn–Narva
description: Nautical base to land ... seems calm in this season end of October. No service

title: (7555) Santiago do Cacém - Unnamed Road
description: Next to the dam, but flatter. Attention enter through the other end of the road in the right turn after the dam (on the side dam there is a big puddle where you could get bogged down). On weekends there must be people because there is a place to barbecue. When you arrive, turn in the grassy part to avoid going down because then very fine sand at the crossing.

title: (7520) Sines - 1 A26-1
description: There are 3 slots for any type of campervan at the end of a normal car parking. Next to the main road and the marina. 10/15 min walk to the old center. No signs its forbid to spend the night. No services.

title: (7520-203) Sines - ZAL Sines
description: After passing through the other parking lots, I preferred to land here. Between the industrial port, the beaches and the city port against the road for the very quiet night port on earthen ground, peaceful and reassuring night. A few night fishing cars around 100 m

title: (7520) Sines - 127 Rua Marquês de Pombal
description: Self service laundry.

title: (7520) Sines - 2 A26-1
description: Parking away from the road so quiet at night

title: (7900-360) Odivelas - 5 N2
description: Just a place to spend the night of you need a free spot around here. It's next to a hotel, it's safe and not alot of noise.

title: (7520-101) Sines - 36 Rua Sacadura Cabral
description: Public bathroom

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Unnamed Road
title_short: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Unnamed Road
description: Very nice place in height with plenty of space and view of the lake (easy to access, free and far from houses)

title: (X479+M3) Sines - Av. da Costa do Norte
title_short: (X479+M3) Sines - Av. da Costa do Norte
description: A little quieter than the parking lot in front of which you have to drive to get here.

title: (7520-196) Sines - 23 Rua dos Pescadores
description: Free parking near beach, center and restaurents. Night calm

title: (7520-109) Sines - R261-5 / Av. da Costa do Norte
title_short: (7520-109) Sines - R261-5 / Av. da Costa do Norte
description: Stay here with a breathtaking view of the ocean. You can stay here legally as it is not the protected coast area . Enough spots for a dozen of vans with good distance for privacy.

address.street: R261-5 / Av. da Costa do Norte

title: (7520-196) Sines - 3 Largo Nossa Senhora das Salvas
title_short: (7520-196) Sines - 3 Largo Nossa Senhora das Salvas
description: Nicely located square overlooking the seaport. Picturesque houses and church in a quiet neighborhood. Ideal to visit the old center of Sines and/or to spend a quiet night in transit.

title: (7555-267) Santiago do Cacém - Unnamed Road
description: Service place on the side of the road, it looks like it was made recently, because it is very clean. The drinking water tastes nice. The directions towards this place are clear to see on the side of the road as you get closer.

title: (A26-1) Sines - 3 Rua Interior do Porto de Pesca de Sines
title_short: (A26-1) Sines - 3 Rua Interior do Porto de Pesca de Sines
description: Small parking lot off the street. Great view of the harbor and the cars don't drive right past you. Trash cans are provided and we had a quiet night here. Attention, you can clearly hear the seagulls, sometimes they come onto the car. Didn't bother us.

address.street: 3 Rua Interior do Porto de Pesca de Sines

title: (7520-200) Sines - 40 Rua do Forte
description: Roadside parking spaces at the entrance to Sines near the port. no problem to stay there overnight. we were 3 CC. beautiful view towards the sea. close to the city.

title: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo
title_short: (7555) Foros do Monte Novo - Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo
description: Opposite the other well-known spots - on the other side of the lake there is a place for a camper that can be easily reached with a little skill. Mine is 6M Land, Sprinter 209 - backwards down the aisle I was able to position myself perfectly with a lake view. There are more standing options slightly above this square, but there is some junk here and there. So a good opportunity to leave a little order. It's so quiet here, so few cars pass on the embankment during the day. Otherwise you are alone, in the distance the campers on the other side.

address.street: Rua de Acacio Guerreiro de Melo

title: (7520) Oliveirinha - M1109
description: Good spot with sea view. Forbidden to spend the night.

title: (7570) - 8 N253-1
description: Stop next to the road. There are many along the way but this one at least allows you to get a few meters and not be at the foot of the asphalt. Perfect for a quiet stop (eat, rest, stretch legs ...). Behind the dunes it seems that there is the beach.

name: Adega dos Nascedios
title: (7630) Adega dos Nascedios
description:
A place to Park inside the private property surrounded by a winery, vineyards where its possible to walk and explore, next to the owners house.
Acess by a good road of a small Village called Fornalhas Novas. 
Wine Shop inside. 
A possibility of winetasting plus local products, with visit to the winery (previous booking)

title: (7900) Odivelas - N257
description: Peaceful place with an unobstructed view of the wild lake. In this place, you feel like you're alone in the world

title: (7580-000) Alcácer do Sal -
description: Simple rest station, picknik area, water and air pressure station, water flow is slow, ok for washing your windows.. shop is in construction (JULY 2022)

title: (7520) Porto Covo - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place to spend the day. a bit of sand so be careful. Enough space for some motorhomes.

title: (7900) Odivelas - Unnamed Road
description: Square in the countryside next to the dam. Near a charming Alentejo village. Nice view, very quiet place. Swimming possible. No convenience. Be careful not to drive into the sand. Bar Snack 800 meters to have a drink!

title: (7500) Sines -
description: Nice place with sea view.

title: (7580) Comporta -
description: Small corner sheltered from view and the world. Road with sand more suitable for 4x4s than vans etc. View of the port, like being on a desert island!!

title: (7500) Sines -
description: Beautiful place for the daytime

title: () Odivelas - Unnamed Road
description: At the edge of the dam, site with bar snack, beach, children playground, outdoor barbecues, picnic, beach NET tables free volleyball, wc and showers.  Possibility to spend the night in the driveway above the site, but not inside the site because camping 1 km, peaceful place with amenities.

title: (7580) Comporta - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful quiet place for a night !!

title: (7920) Alvito - Unnamed Road
description: Located on the at the ‘barragem de olivedas’ lake, between the picnic spot (with a very nice bar/restaurant) and the camping. The picnic spot (5 min walk) has toilets & showers and drinking water. Picnic spot itself gets checked by GNR quite regularly but camping a bit further out/behind it, leaves you a beautiful spot next to the lake with services close by.
